Quiet neighborhood 15 mins from the Prudential Center and 20 mins from NYC. Just over 10mins to EWR Newark Liberty Airport.

name: Best NYC Studio-EWR Airport+Free Parking
description:
Studio with independent entrance, private bathroom and small kitchenette. Free parking space for 1 car. Express bus from the house to 42st & 8ave Time Square Area. FASTER than subway ride from Brooklyn PLEASE KEEP READING or Queens. 5 minutes from EWR Airport, Kean University, Beth Israel Hospital. 15 minutes from Prudential Center & Harrison Red Bull Arena. Our promise: EASY automated self-check-in, clean, safe & we NEVER cancel :-)

The space
The studio has a small kitchenette with fridge and microwave but no stove, 2 full size beds and one sofa bed. Don’t forget to read the amenity list for more details and watch our virtual tour on You Tube BEST STUDIO NYC.

Why Book With Me.
As a traveler, I believe that one shouldn't spend lots of money on a hotel or room. Instead, most of the budget should go to the ADVENTURE itself. I also believe that affordability shouldn't compromise comfort. This is why I offer the listings with the most value per dolla
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is really quiet, safe and diverse (American, Portuguese, Brazilian and Latin American). Trust me, you will need a nice and quiet place to rest after you are done exploring New York City. There's a Walgreens across from the house to buy basic items and a Dunkin Donuts for a quick breakfast.
host_about:
Let me start by saying, thank you for considering our listings.

We are passionate about the guest experience. We stay in each listing from time to time so we can feel what our guests feel and make sure our guests have the best experience possible. Our improvement to do list is never ending. We take the time to address all of our guests concerns and make their stay as comfortable as possible.

Our company, BESTCITYROOM, com has its own website, IG @ BESTCITYROOM and (Hidden by Airbnb) page BESTCITYROOM where you can find more information about us and reach us for host consulting, Airbnb investments, monetizing Timeshares and doing Airbnb remotely worldwide.

We are always on the move and only a few guests get to know us personally. However, if you would to meet us we will make sure to have you down in our calendar :-)

We have been to many countries and endless cities. We have travel for over 20 years, fluent on 6 languages. There's a big probability we have been to where you come from and have gone where you going next, so feel free to ask for traveling advice.

Thank you for your business and keep traveling/exploring until its your time to rest.

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

host_about:
Let me start by saying, thank you for considering our listings.

We are passionate about the guest experience. We stay in each listing from time to time so we can feel what our guests feel and make sure our guests have the best experience possible. Our improvement to do list is never ending. We take the time to address all of our guests concerns and make their stay as comfortable as possible.

Our company, BESTCITYROOM, com has its own website, IG @ BESTCITYROOM and (Hidden by Airbnb) page BESTCITYROOM where you can find more information about us and reach us for host consulting, Airbnb investments, monetizing Timeshares and doing Airbnb remotely worldwide.

We are always on the move and only a few guests get to know us personally. However, if you would to meet us we will make sure to have you down in our calendar :-)

We have been to many countries and endless cities. We have travel for over 20 years, fluent on 6 languages. There's a big probability we have been to where you come from and have gone where you going next, so feel free to ask for traveling advice.

Thank you for your business and keep traveling/exploring until its your time to rest.

Meanwhile, the nearest major strain station is the Harrison PATH station, about a 10 minute bus  or Uber ride away from the apartment.

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

host_about:
Let me start by saying, thank you for considering our listings.

We are passionate about the guest experience. We stay in each listing from time to time so we can feel what our guests feel and make sure our guests have the best experience possible. Our improvement to do list is never ending. We take the time to address all of our guests concerns and make their stay as comfortable as possible.

Our company, BESTCITYROOM, com has its own website, IG @ BESTCITYROOM and (Hidden by Airbnb) page BESTCITYROOM where you can find more information about us and reach us for host consulting, Airbnb investments, monetizing Timeshares and doing Airbnb remotely worldwide.

We are always on the move and only a few guests get to know us personally. However, if you would to meet us we will make sure to have you down in our calendar :-)

We have been to many countries and endless cities. We have travel for over 20 years, fluent on 6 languages. There's a big probability we have been to where you come from and have gone where you going next, so feel free to ask for traveling advice.

Thank you for your business and keep traveling/exploring until its your time to rest.

name: Large Studio Apt  close to Newark Airport and NYC
description:
Nice studio apartment in the center of Kearny Ave. 6 miles to Newark Airport, 25 mins to downtown Manhattan via car or PATH Train. New Jersey bus number 30 stops on every corner and takes you directly to Newark Penn station, or you can get off at Harrison Ave. and walk 6 blocks to the Harrison PATH station. 15 min. walk to the PATH Station in Harrison from apartment. Plenty of bars, restaurants along Kearny Ave. Home to Tony Sopranos Sartrialli's Pork Store. Red Bull Stadium is 10 min. away

The space
Large studio apartment with Full size bed, Queen size futon, eat in kitchen with refrigerator microwave and coffee pot( there is no stove) Easy access to Manhattan, Liberty science center in Jersey City,
Hoboken, and the Irounbound section of Newark(Ferry St.) famous for Portuguese and Spanish cuisine. Five minute drive to Red Bull Stadium in Harrison

Guest access
The entire studio is for the use of the guest

name: 2BR Best of South Orange, Newark & NYC in Minutes
description:
Relax in style in your home away from home. This cozy 2-bedroom apartment, on the 3rd floor of a private quiet 3-family home has all you need for a quality stay. We are in a quiet neighborhood on the Newark/South Orange border, with great neighbors that look out for each other.
Just steps to Seton Hall University. Enjoy downtown South Orange restaurants and bars. A short ride from Newark Airport and downtown Newark. Plus, New York City is a 35min train ride away. Perfect for a great stay!

The space
This cozy 2 bedroom apartment accommodates only up to 4 guests. To get to the apartment, you will need to walk up 2 flights of stairs. Each bedroom has a Queen size bed laid with pristine white sheets. The living room has a sofa, two arm chairs and a TV for your enjoyment. Our kitchenette is equipped with a microwave, kettle, toaster, French coffee press and portable cooktop. In the bathroom there is a charming claw foot bathtub with shower head. We offer free dr
neighborhood_overview:
This home is right on the Newark South Orange border. Seton Hall University is steps away making it a perfect place to stay if you are visiting the School. The VA Medical center is close by. It is also only an 8 min drive to downtown South Orange where you can enjoy restaurants, cafes . This home gives you access to the best of both Worlds.
Plus! jump on the NJ Transit train to New York City from the South Orange Train Station only a 3 min drive away.
host_about: Family first. Love traveling and sharing our home with you.

name: Large Family Friendly Victorian - 30 min to NYC
description:
Beautiful 3 story Victorian home built in 1905, renovated in 2019. Comfortable modern living with original details such as beautiful hardwood floors throughout, high ceilings, a beautiful porch and fireplace.
and lots of space to cook, entertain, play, work and relax. And all this within a 40 min commute to Manhattan! We just love our home and hope you will enjoy it too!

The space
The house is yours! We only rent it out when we travel, so except for one room with personal items (this is our 7th bedroom that we use as a wardrobe), the whole house and backyard are available for guests to enjoy. Great large living spaces downstairs, kitchen, dining room, lounge and tv room, plus a half bathroom. And upstairs 3 bedrooms and a full bath on each floor, including 2 fully equipped and quiet home offices (one private office and one additional office (with seated and standing desk) in master bedroom. Also a peleton bike and home gym with weights, exercise balls and y
neighborhood_overview: A very green and walkable area with several small and large parks within a short walk, including playgrounds, sports fields, and exercise equipment. It is also only a short walk (10 min) into town with lots of small restaurants and coffeehops, as well as a direct train to Penn station.
host_about:
A fun-loving, hard-working, life-enjoying world citizen
Having lived in many places across Europe, Africa and Asia. I call Amsterdam, Johannesburg and New York home and we love to continue exploring known and new places.
With our 4 kids, it has proven a little more challenging...but still possible :-)

name: Luxury Muwuyu Queen enSuite @MushaindoroHS
description:
We don't do ordinary at Mushaindoro Hospitality Suites. Our self-catering Southern African B&B offers colorful contemporary art design, beautiful home decor, with full service amenities. It's vibrant yet soothing and comfortable. Muwuyu enSuite has 1 queen bed, private bath, 48" Smart TV, 2 closets, plus view of the garden and delivers an extravagant unique hospitality experience! You are on a separate guest floor from host with self-catering amenities, high speed wi-fi, cable. Book us.

The space
Thanks for considering Mushaindoro Hospitality Suites, the Jewel in African Hospitality. I hope you choose to stay with us and we promise your stay with us will exceed your expectations. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic we have put in place new Health & Wellness precautions for the benefit of all guests, please read before confirming your reservation to comply with our health sanitation measures. In addition, we supply guests with a mask, latex gloves, sanitizers, disi
neighborhood_overview:
Mushaindoro Hospitality suites are a perfect traveler's location for 1) Restaurants - fine & casual dinning; 2) Recreation & Entertainment; and 3) Public transportation to NYC, Newark Liberty International Airport (with access to shuttle services to JFK & LaGuardia); major shopping malls (Jersey Gardens, Short Hills & Livingston); and the major Universities of NJ (Rutgers, Seaton Hall, NJIT, University Hospital, Kean and Montclair Universities). In addition, our photos are Airbnb verified which means, what you see is exactly what our luxury suites offer.

Our restaurants comprise of high-end multicultural restaurants of Maplewood and South Orange villages. Coffee houses, diners, ethnic and gourmet restaurants offer everything from morning coffee and bagels to late night cafe latte. We also have a variety of exotic fast food take-out establishments that deliver like sushi, Chinese, Italian, Ethiopian, Mexican, Caribbean cuisine, Papa John’s, Dominos and many more. Then we h
host_about: Welcome to Mushaindoro Hospitality Suites, the Jewel in African Hospitality. I am your host and proprietor Tendai.  Originally from Zimbabwe, Mushaindoro Hospitality Suites gives me the opportunity to share my traditional Shona culture, blended with my acquired American experiences.  Our suites are names after Shona trees, mostly wild fruit trees that grow in this southern African savanna region of  the continent. name: Studio Apartment near NYC & EWR
description:
This fully furnished studio apartment w/ its own private entrance is 5 min walk away from Light Rail Station and 20 min away from Newark International Airport (EWR) via car services. Free street parking. The Grand Branch Brook Park is 1 ½ block away. The light rail takes you to Newark Penn Station in less than 15 min. From there, you can take NJ Transit( 15 Min to NYC), Path Train(35 Min to NYC) or Bus to NYC or walk to NJPAC & Prudential Center. Guests can check in anytime.

The space
This 420 sqft studio apartment with its own private entrance offers all sorts of amenities and comforts making it a truly home away from home experience. The apartment is located at a one family house in the historical Forest Hill neighborhood of Newark, NJ. neighborhood_overview: The historic Forest Hill Neighborhood of Newark, NJ, is the home of the world famous Cherry Blossom Festival.  It also boasts an impressive collection of colonial and Victorian houses. There is also the Grand Branch Brook Park that offers resident opportunities to residents to exercise or relax.  The neighborhood has easy access to public transportation. It is also convenient to Newark Liberty International Airport (-20 min. drive) and JFK Airport (1 hr. and 15 Minutes . Drive and 1 ½ hr. train.) Within walking distance there are Super Markets and various ethnic restaurants. Neighboring towns of Bloomfield, Clifton, Nutley and Montclair are within easy driving distance.

name: Comfort for long stays, close to Pru, EWR, & NYC
description:
This house on a quiet street in the North Ironbound has all the amenities for a relaxing long stay. You have easy access to all of Newark and the greater NYC area. There is a spot to work from home, and many excellent coffee shops and restaurants are nearby.

*5 minutes walk to PATH *30 minutes to NYC*10 minutes to EWR airport *Fast Wi-Fi*Washer/Dryer*Office desk and chair

The space
This recently renovated house is available for long stays (28 days or longer).

**First Floor**:
A well-equipped, eat-in kitchen: fridge, stove, microwave, oven, espresso machine, coffee maker, toaster, rice cooker, pots and pans, and plates and cutlery. Feel free to use anything you find in the kitchen cabinets (e.g. spices, herbs).
Living room with a comfortable couch and TV with Netflix.
Laptop-friendly workspace with a desk and office chair.

**Second Floor**:
A steep staircase takes you up to the second floor.
One bedroom
neighborhood_overview:
The Ironbound is a unique section of Newark, known for its close-knit Portuguese/Brazilian community, and its terrific restaurants.

If you like dining out, this is the place to be. Restaurants within a 5 minute walk offer a great selection of BBQ and seafood, and a lively, European atmosphere, including long unhurried dinners, and outside seating.
host_about:

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

neighborhood_overview:
Please go to GOIRONBOUND com to learn more about the neighborhood.

We have been in this neighborhood for over 20 years and seen it develop to a nice, safe, beautiful and diverse neighborhood. It almost feels like NYC, there are lots of restaurants, bars, lounges, clubs, shopping areas, markets etc and almost anything you could think of. Trust us, you won't be disappointed!
host_about:
Let me start by saying, thank you for considering our listings.

We are passionate about the guest experience. We stay in each listing from time to time so we can feel what our guests feel and make sure our guests have the best experience possible. Our improvement to do list is never ending. We take the time to address all of our guests concerns and make their stay as comfortable as possible.

Our company, BESTCITYROOM, com has its own website, IG @ BESTCITYROOM and (Hidden by Airbnb) page BESTCITYROOM where you can find more information about us and reach us for host consulting, Airbnb investments, monetizing Timeshares and doing Airbnb remotely worldwide.

We are always on the move and only a few guests get to know us personally. However, if you would to meet us we will make sure to have you down in our calendar :-)

We have been to many countries and endless cities. We have travel for over 20 years, fluent on 6 languages. There's a big probability we have been to where you come from and have gone where you going next, so feel free to ask for traveling advice.

Thank you for your business and keep traveling/exploring until its your time to rest.

neighborhood_overview:
Some of the reviews about the neighborhood are old.
The area is safe. There are few bad folks like in every big city.
The area is being revitalized.
People around here are friendly. Don't be surprised if someone says "Good morning" or tries to help you.
Take a tour around Newark by doing a search on "City of Newark tax collector NJ". You will see a street view map. Please click on it and take a virtual tour.
host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

name: The King's Daughter
description:
My place is close to Newark Airport, Newark Penn Station NJ Pac and World Trade Center in NYC!
My place is good for solo adventurers, business travelers, airport personnel like stewardess, pilots, layovers, seniors and people traveling with their furry friends (pets).

The space
My home is eclectic, spacious, warm and sunny! Airy and bright, entertaining and interesting. Lovely, even while I update it!

Guest access
You will have access to my entire home except my private quarters. This house has only one large bathroom and we share.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively! Children, the elderly and the young enjoy their properties and we take care of where we live.
host_about:
I am an author, singer and craftspeson. I work from home and I presently reside at this listing and I am available to answer any of your questions. My children are all grown up (this was not their home) and now I'm in a new space, I want to share it with interesting honest people. 

 My home is very clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, you cannot rent out my entire home and my yard is accessible. My home is also very secured and I have a few surveillance cameras and secure locks on all doors and windows. My neighborhood is a family neighborhood. Lots of large families live on this street. It has been a noisy summer, due too the fact these people CANNOT AFFORD VACATIONS OR TRAVEL, SO THEY HANG OUT AT HOME. Now since it that time of year where the children go back to school, the neighbor hood will become quiet again.

Now in my home there are seven rooms. You will have access to the first and second floors, unless your party requires my additional space, then the third floor can be used. I am very open to children and I have two heavy duty twin air mattresses (which are quite comfortable) and a spare bed in my office on the third floor if need be. (Pictures are not available due to this area being my private quarters!) And I do not have any pets, but I am open to small animals if they are house broken and will not destroy my home.

As my guest, I ask that you respect my things and my privacy and I will do the same. I love people and hope by opening up my home I get to meet some new life long friends! I promise you a comfy safe place and good whole foods! 

(And for parents of young people under 25, they WILL NOT have access to any alcohol. My bar is closed and locked! Just so you'll know and can feel at ease. There will no be consumption at my house!) 

ALSO LET ME ADD: For those who need transportation, I have a reliable driver with a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Lincoln TownCar, Fully Insured and Licensed available for tours in NYC, transport from all area airports, etc to my location. My code is VAL (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , or you can make a r (Email hidden by Airbnb) or call him at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) 

Looking forward to seeing you! GOD bless!

Valerie

You will find fully functional kitchenette, luxury bathroom with top of the line fixtures. Wall-hung Toto toilet is a modern marvel. Kohler fixtures in the shower add a nice visual touch and give strong massage. Stone and glass backsplash surrounds entire kitchen.
We LOVE watching cable, so you will have a chance to enjoy every single channel cable has to offer.


Total privacy: the apartment is located on top of stand alone garage, there are no shared walls.
neighborhood_overview:
Hidden oasis of a Historical neighborhood, near park. Has lots of turn of the century charm with little bit of urban vibe. Ultimate commuters dream: Newark airport, train station, highways. Not far from Ironbound restaurants and pubs. Free on street PARKING, readily available.

NJIT, RUTGERTS, UMDNJ and major hospitals are accessible by bus or car.

You may borrow our bike to ride around the area, very scenic neighborhood. No house is alike.
host_about: We invite you to uncover the hidden side of Newark NJ and stay in one of our historic homes in Forest Hill and Ironbound. Both are truly the NJ best kept secrets - safety, friendly neighbors, 30 min to NYC, 20 mins to EWR. FH offers privacy and surburban feel, while Ironbound is a vibrant, "happening" place. We work in the city and communite to NYC daily, we're both new comers to this country and proximity to the Newark international airport remains very important to us.   As proud homeowners we had them rebuilt and retained a construction company to perform maintenance regularly.  You are welcome to stay with us.

name: Quaint Home Newly Renovated Artistic Apt near NYC
description:
We invite you to stay in this quaint 1-BR apartment with separate entry on the basement floor of our Victorian house within close proximity to New York City and the Newark International Airport. Enjoy verdant tranquility with convenient access to the city!

The space
- In Victorian house.
- Separate, basement apartment with private entry.
- Approx. 800 sq. ft.
- 1 bedrooms - featuring a full-size bed, with a futon in the living room.
- Free wireless internet.
- Cable TV
- Spacious apartment with fully equipped kitchen, including range and refrigerator, toaster, microwave oven, french press coffee maker.
- Hair dryer, iron and ironing board are provided.
- Plenty of storage space.
- One car driveway parking.
- Shady porch & yard with ample trees/plants.
- Quiet, residential, cherry blossom park area.
- Fresh market, liquor store, and tennis courts are within short walking distance, a couple of blocks away
neighborhood_overview:
This is a historic neighborhood, with the tree-lined streets and mansions of the old days. The famous Cherry Blossom Park (with the most cherry trees in the US), designed by Frederick Law Olmsted (who also designed NYC's Central Park), is a short walking distance away. It is equally beautiful at any season of the year.
The NJ Performing Art Center (NJPAC), with such events as Poetry Festivals and musical concerts for all tastes, and the Newark Public Library are a short ride away by the Light Rail.
host_about: We are a retired married couple who enjoys experiencing all the wonders of life -- especially traveling. To date, we've been to 4 continents, countless countries, and nearly every state in America. Among our favorite sites so far were the Great Wall of China, seeing the Northern Lights in Iceland, and Iguazu Falls in South America, to name a few. We also enjoy frequent visits to nearby New York City to see the opera, independent films, and all the other many cultural experiences the city has to offer.

name: Ideal for families, easy NYC train-5.5 bdrms/3 bth
description:
Ideal for visiting NJ with day trips to NYC, this duplex apartment sleeps up to 20 and is two blocks from Newark Broad St station.

Do note that
-We ask that you agree to the house rules, and provide names of all guests, and reason of your trip.
-We strictly enforce: No parties. No visitors. No marijuana or smoking on the property.
-We are in Newark. Our neighborhood is not trendy, but it is safe and central.
-We live on site, on the 3rd floor apartment. During the day you might hear our kids.

The space
Fully-renovated duplex apartment with new kitchen and appliances; modern, cozy furniture and art throughout. The entrance to the apartment is on the second floor after an easy flight of stairs from the main foyer. The main common spaces -- kitchen, living room, and dinning area -- are on this floor as well as 3 bedrooms (1-3) and 2 full bathrooms. On the ground floor there are 2 additional bedrooms, a semi-private alcove with a doubl
neighborhood_overview:
It is very important to us that you understand our location before booking as that is the one thing we cannot change. We are in the Lower Broadway neighborhood just north of Downtown Newark which is home to a diverse population of Latinos and immigrants from other backgrounds. This means that great food, access to public transportation, shows and many other great perks are within walking distance.

This is a vibrant neighborhood that, like other key areas of Newark, is going through significant renewal and redevelopment, processes that are still very much under way (i.e., we are not as beautiful as we will soon be). If you don't let yourself be stopped by the couple of lots waiting redevelopment around us, you will find an array of small family-run restaurants and stores within 1-2 blocks radius of the apartment. Still, while luxury condos have begun to pop up here and there, we feel safe, and we think our neighbors are among the best, the Lower Broadway still remains much
host_about:
My work and travel have taught me to appreciate people's hospitality and the warmth of their homes.  As a host, my husband and I will ensure your stay with us is nothing short of exceptional. As a guest, I will take really good care of your place and be sure to leave no trace behind! 

My husband, our lil' daughter Luna, and myself would love the chance to host you in our apartment in Newark!

We don't smoke or do drugs. 

Hablamos español. 
On parle français.

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

name: Spacious Rm. w/en suite close to EWR & Cruise Port
description:
Our Home is located in the Historic Weequahic district of the City. Across from Weequahic Park. Newark Beth Israel Hospital is 9 blocks away. Walking distance to the 107 bus to Manhattan. An 8 minutes taxi ride from Newark Airport and a 15 minutes taxi ride from Newark Penn Station, the Performing Arts Center, the Prudential Arena and an abundance of Spanish and Portuguese Restaurants in the Ironbound district adjacent to downtown.

The space
Quiet block right across the street from the historic Weequahic Park.Spacious room sleeps four. Our room is perfect for anyone with walking difficulties. No stairs into home and the room has a walk in shower with a shower chair available. Toilet safety frame available too.

Guest access
Large room with private bathroom, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. Access to front sitting room also.
neighborhood_overview: Residential neighborhood with lovely park across the street complete with public golf course.
host_about: I am a married self employed contractor specializing in small jobs. My wife and I love to travel to beach destinations. Jamaica and Antigua are our current favorite islands but we are always ready to explore. W are new to hosting and make every effort to have our guests feel at home. That is what we would look for in an Airbnb.

name: Cute and super central!
description:
In the heart of the cultural center known as the Ironbound, the apartment is super central. Located a short walk or Uber ride from Newark Penn Station, it's then just 20 minutes away from Manhattan. Newark Airport is less than a 10 minute drive. If you're in town for an event, the Prudential is within walking distance and the NJ Performing Arts Center is a short ride away. Delicious restaurants nearby.

This house is smoke free. Please respect that.

Other things to note
Off-street parking may be available though it's not a certainty. Please message me and ask!

And the apartment has a nice alkaline water filter :)

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

neighborhood_overview: Quiet street conveniently located 5 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. 10 minutes from Downtown Newark and Jersey Gardens Outlet Mall. 15-20 from other neighboring malls and stadiums (Short Hills, American Dream, Meadowlands arenas). host_about: Hi, my name is  Patrick Mamudu. I am co-hosting this humble abode with my mother, Catherine Luke.  We have lived in the Southward section of Newark, NJ since the early '80s.  Our current interests are traveling, shopping, teaching (in various public high schools in the city of Newark, New Jersey), cooking, attending church every Sunday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math), movies, music, and medicine.  Our ethnic origin is Nigeria, and we take pride in our culture. We love wearing our native culture clothes and also cooking many of the staple dishes from there (jollof rice, fried rice, moi moi, akara, suya, pounded yam, etc). A fun fact about Catherine is that she has been to several European countries during the '90s in order to sell many of the native clothing that is a staple in our country. I have been to London, Italy, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Spain, France, Austria,  etc.  We are devout Christians and believe that God is the centerpiece of our life; he has been good to us.  Our faith allows us to be hospitable hosts who value all of our guests. We take the extra step in making sure your stay is comfortable and feels just like home. We are also helpful in regards to movement within the Greater New York region.

name: Pad in Up and Coming Neighborhood Outside of NYC
description:
Hi guys! I'm Ray and my place is available to anyone who wants to come visit the Greater New York City Area.

If you have any questions about how easy it is to get around here, please ask me! In being a local, I feel like I can help more than an internet research =).

The space
It is a cozy and comfortable place just minutes away from NYC. This pad has neutral colored walls and a low-key decoration to avoid overwhelming its guests, thus providing serenity and tranquility to visitors while staying here.

Guest access
The address, code and check in instructions will be provided the day prior to your arrival.

PARKING:
****THERE IS NO PARKING IN UNIT****
Parking is off the street only. You can park anywhere on the street and no permit is required.

LAUNDRY ROOM
There is a washer and dryer located in the building. Keep in mind that the laundry room is a shared space with other guests. Be aware of t
neighborhood_overview:
Gentrification is the better way to describe Newark in one word. For many years Newark has been going through this process, but things seem to have picked up at much faster pace in the last few years. Big organizations such as Whole Foods, Barnes & Noble, Starbucks, Nike and many others have noticed something in Newark when they decided to open shop here, now it’s your turn to come and see it.

My spot is located in the IRONBOUND section of Newark, and according to Neighborhood Scout, the IRONBOUND is Newark’s SAFEST neighborhood. Additional to being the safest, it offers the broadest culinary diversity in the area with many restaurants offering the best Spanish Paella, Portuguese seafood, Brazilian Churrasco, and many others.

Guests who are staying in, can take advantage of all the restaurants and bars that are popping up throughout the city while staying in a comfortable place that is close to pretty much everything.
host_about:
Hi there, am I Ray. It's lovely to meet you. 
My husband and I love to meet new people, and share the passion of traveling. 
I am easily reachable, so if you have any question, do not hesitate to contact me. If I, for any reason cannot help, my husband certainly will. 

I look forward to hosting you!

Hi  This is Mario!

name: Colonial Home Next to EWR and NYC! Best Deal #2
description:
A colonial home that has maple wooden trim and tan colors on the inside. A fireplace is also available that we do not use and that isn't active but makes for nice decoration. All brick exterior with tile roofing and white pillars on the front porch. Lots of leather sofas and maple wooden trimmed dining table is also available. Conveniently located next to Newark International Airport and Downtown Newark (5 mins away, details in additional information), as well as parks and stores.

The space
The private room you have access to is spacious, comfortable bed, 32” Roku TV, and AC for your enjoyment.

Guest access
Guests will have access to their room, the bathroom, the fridge downstairs, the kitchen and stove if needed, the porch. The kitchen is accessible, however, we will only allow very light cooking (Ex: boiling water, microwave, and limit of cooking that can be done in 10 mins or less)!

Other things to note
Weed smokin
neighborhood_overview: Quiet street conveniently located 5 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. 10 minutes from Downtown Newark and Jersey Gardens Outlet Mall. 15-20 from other neighboring malls and stadiums (Short Hills, American Dream, Meadowlands arenas). We are also 30 mins from Lower Manhattan which is accessible by a direct bus that has a stop on the corner of Meeker and Elizabeth Avenue (down the street).
host_about: Hi, my name is  Patrick Mamudu. I am co-hosting this humble abode with my mother, Catherine Luke.  We have lived in the Southward section of Newark, NJ since the early '80s.  Our current interests are traveling, shopping, teaching (in various public high schools in the city of Newark, New Jersey), cooking, attending church every Sunday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math), movies, music, and medicine.  Our ethnic origin is Nigeria, and we take pride in our culture. We love wearing our native culture clothes and also cooking many of the staple dishes from there (jollof rice, fried rice, moi moi, akara, suya, pounded yam, etc). A fun fact about Catherine is that she has been to several European countries during the '90s in order to sell many of the native clothing that is a staple in our country. I have been to London, Italy, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Spain, France, Austria,  etc.  We are devout Christians and believe that God is the centerpiece of our life; he has been good to us.  Our faith allows us to be hospitable hosts who value all of our guests. We take the extra step in making sure your stay is comfortable and feels just like home. We are also helpful in regards to movement within the Greater New York region.

description:
Hi! We are mother-daughter duo Francesca & Francine, having both lived in The Ironbound for 20+ years, we still have yet to see everything this historic and cultured city has to offer. Being only walking distance from Newark Penn & Harrison Train Stations, Prudential Center, Red Bull Stadium, NJ PAC, and timeless restaurants, and bakeries, will have you never bored, never hungry and never wanting to leave!​​ Come explore and taste your way through Brick City!

The space
Apartment is on the second floor (12 steps) with its own separate entrance and exit

20 minutes to/from NYC

1 train stop away from Manhattan

We are mother-daughter duo Francesca & Francine, having both lived in The Ironbound for 20+ years, we still have yet to see everything this historic and cultured city has to offer.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet street conveniently located 5 minutes from Newark Liberty International Airport. 10 minutes from Downtown Newark and Jersey Gardens Outlet Mall. 15-20 from other neighboring malls and stadiums (Short Hills, American Dream, Meadowlands arenas). host_about: Hi, my name is  Patrick Mamudu. I am co-hosting this humble abode with my mother, Catherine Luke.  We have lived in the Southward section of Newark, NJ since the early '80s.  Our current interests are traveling, shopping, teaching (in various public high schools in the city of Newark, New Jersey), cooking, attending church every Sunday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math), movies, music, and medicine.  Our ethnic origin is Nigeria, and we take pride in our culture. We love wearing our native culture clothes and also cooking many of the staple dishes from there (jollof rice, fried rice, moi moi, akara, suya, pounded yam, etc). A fun fact about Catherine is that she has been to several European countries during the '90s in order to sell many of the native clothing that is a staple in our country. I have been to London, Italy, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany, Spain, France, Austria,  etc.  We are devout Christians and believe that God is the centerpiece of our life; he has been good to us.  Our faith allows us to be hospitable hosts who value all of our guests. We take the extra step in making sure your stay is comfortable and feels just like home. We are also helpful in regards to movement within the Greater New York region.

neighborhood_overview:
Some of the reviews about the neighborhood are old.
The area is safe. There are few bad folks like in every big city.
The area is being revitalized.
People around here are friendly. Don't be surprised if someone says "Good morning" or tries to help you.
Take a tour around Irvington by doing a search on "City of Irvington tax collector NJ". You will see a street view map. Please click on it and take a virtual tour.

Getting around is easy since there are many options. This is a central location with easy access to all major highways and public transportation.

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

Often booked during the day for photography, tv and film shoots. This converted loft from the 1920s has an emphasis on natural lighting, gritty textures, historic props and automotive displays. 4,500 unobstructed square feet.

The space
20ft high wooded barrel-trussed roof. Eight original 9x9' restored factory windows. 60' vehicle ramp to park on.
neighborhood_overview: The Ironbound section of Newark is almost entirely Portuguese and Brazilian, you'll feel like you're in an entirely different country but are 10 minutes from downtown Newark and a quick train ride into NYC.
host_about: Passionate about creating the right scene for a shoot, with specific interests in classic vehicles, jewellry design, rugby and art. London born and raised, Syracuse University Alum, I opened up this space after playing rugby full time on the West coast.

name: A Hidden Gem
description: This Hidden Gem is the perfect getaway. Only  walking distance from Newark Penn & Harrison Train Stations, Prudential Center, Red Bull Stadium, NJ PAC, and timeless restaurants, and bakeries, will have you never bored, never hungry and never wanting to leave! Come explore and taste your way through Brick City!
host_about:
We are mother-daughter duo Francesca & Francine, having both lived in The Ironbound for 20+ years, we still have yet to see everything this historic and cultured city has to offer.

I, Francesca, am a student, and when I’m not studying you can find me on a plane. My mother, Francine, turned her passion for travel into a business by owning her own luxury travel agency. 

Having traveled around world we have poured our passion and experiences into providing guests a luxurious stay. Together we invite you to join us as we explore and eat our way through Brick City!

name: Sparkling Guesthouse in Ironbound, mins NYC, EWR
description:
Relax in Sparkling GuestHouse in Ironbound, privacy of your own home with easy access to NYC, Newark airport and local attractions. Enjoy vaulted ceilings with recessed lights. Stay comfortable with cooling / heating minisplit, Queen size bed, TV w/ HBO, showtime, and WIFI. Explore the shops galore along Wilson Ave and Ferry streets: bakeries, beauty spots, sports bars.Commute to the city 23 min, easy access to highways, EWR.
Don’t take my word for it, come and see for yourself!

The space
SEE IT - BOOK IT! Seriously Awesome luxurious escape offers total privacy: the GuestHouse is located in the backyard, there are no shared walls, no street noise, no foot traffic from above or below. SERENITY! Commute to NYC is a breeze from Penn station via PATH; simple access to major highways: NJTP. Clean, clear, minimalistic set up will help you unwind and relax. Draw yourself a hot bath, get the coffee going and relax to one of HBO shows or your favorite tune for a
neighborhood_overview:
You will like Ironbound for it's easy commute to the city and abundance of restaurants, local shops, cafes and bars. All are located within walking distance from the house and are fun to visit.

Ultimate commuters dream: Newark airport, train station, highways, surrounded by Ironbound restaurants and pubs..

NJIT, RUTGERTS, UMDNJ and major hospitals are accesible by bus or car.
host_about: We invite you to uncover the hidden side of Newark NJ and stay in one of our historic homes in Forest Hill and Ironbound. Both are truly the NJ best kept secrets - safety, friendly neighbors, 30 min to NYC, 20 mins to EWR. FH offers privacy and surburban feel, while Ironbound is a vibrant, "happening" place. We work in the city and communite to NYC daily, we're both new comers to this country and proximity to the Newark international airport remains very important to us.   As proud homeowners we had them rebuilt and retained a construction company to perform maintenance regularly.  You are welcome to stay with us.

neighborhood_overview:
Some of the reviews about the neighborhood are old.
The area is safe. There are few bad folks like in every big city.
The area is being revitalized.
People around here are friendly. Don't be surprised if someone says "Good morning" or tries to help you.
Take a tour around Irvington by doing a search on "City of Irvington tax collector NJ". You will see a street view map. Please click on it and take a virtual tour.

Getting around is easy since there are many options. This is a central location with easy access to all major highways and public transportation.
host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

neighborhood_overview: Ironbound is a neighborhood in the city of Newark in Essex County, New Jersey, United States. It is a largely working-class, close-knit, multi-ethnic community covering approximately four square miles (10 km²). Historically, the area was called "Dutch Neck," "Down Neck," or simply "the Neck," due to the appearance of the curve of the Passaic River. The Ironbound is part of Newark's East Ward and is directly east of Newark Penn Station and Downtown Newark, and south and west of the river, over which passes the Jackson Street Bridge, connecting to Harrison and Kearny.

neighborhood_overview:
We are located near the train station that goes to New York City the trip takes between 20 to 25 minutes.
We live in an area of ​​Portuguese and Brazilians people very close to restaurants, shops, pharmacies, laundry and a hospital that is 8 minutes by car.
host_about:
Hello everyone my name is Gabriela and Diego Figueroa, We are 30 & 26 years old, We are brothers and We live together in a beautiful traditional style apartment located in the city of Newark in the state of New Jersey ZIP code 07105

We are located near NJ Transit, the train station that goes to New York City, the trip takes between 20 to 25 minutes.

We live in an area of Portuguese and Brazilians people very close to restaurants, shops, pharmacies, laundry and a hospital 8 minutes by car.

Through the Air BnB program We are renting a nice bedroom with all the necessary amenities to enjoy your stay here in the United States.

The apartment has a living room, dining room, kitchen, two bedrooms and a bathroom, the rooms are connected one to the other  and has a very big curtain divider for your privacy.

The bedroom we are renting is large clean and cozy has three large windows, has a soft and comfortable king bed with 2 night stand and lamps, pillows, bedspread and sheet, has 1 white sofa which you can use, a furniture to put clothes, a bed table for eating and a Smart TV with Netflix, Hulu, Youtube, and Firefox Browser included.

The bathroom has hot and cold water and is included towel, toilet paper, soap, shampoo and a hair dryer.

The kitchen is large with all electronic devices such as microwave, blender among others and a dining room, including plates, glasses and plastic cutlery especially for the guest, you have a place in the refrigerator for your food and a shelf.

Service included:
1.- Internet Wi-fi.
2.- Heating.
3.- Water to drink.

Prohibitions:
1.- You can not bring people or pets to the apartment.
2.- No parties are made.
3.- No drugs are allowed.
3.- When you use the bathroom you have to leave it clean.
4.- If you eat something you have to throw it in the kitchen trash.
  
We offer you the best service, amenities and environment!


SPANISH VERSION:

Hola a todos mi nombre es Gabriela y Diego Figueroa tenemos 30 y 26 años de edad, somos hermanos y vivimos juntos en un hermoso apartamento estilo tradicional ubicado en la ciudad de Newark en el estado de New Jersey codigo postal 07105

Estamos ubicados cerca de la estacion de trenes que van a la ciudad de Nueva York el viaje dura entre 20 a 25 minutos.

Vivimos en una zona de Portugueses y Brasileros muy cerca de restaurantes, tiendas, farmacias, lavanderia y un hospital que queda a 8 minutos en auto.

Por medio del programa Air Bn B estamos dejando en Alquiler un lindo dormitorio con todas las comodidades necesarias para que disfrutes de tu estadia aqui en los Estados Unidos.

El apartamento cuenta con sala, comedor, cocina, dos dormitorios y un bano, el uno esta conectado con el otro dormitorio  por el cual cuenta con un separador de cortina para su privacidad.

El dormitorio que estamos rentando es grande tiene tres ventanales grandes es acogedor tiene 1 cama king suave y comoda con 2 veladores y lamparas a los extremos, almohadas,  colcha y sabana, tiene 1 sillon blanco donde puedes hacer uso, un mueble para poner ropa, una mesa de cama para comer y un Smart Tv con Netflix, Hulu, Youtube, y Navegador Firefox incluido.

El baño cuenta con agua caliente y fria y esta incluido la toalla, papel higienico, jabon, shampoo y una secadora de pelo.

La cocina es grande cuenta con todos los aparatos electronicos como microondas, licuadora entre otros y un comedor, incluido platos, vasos y cubiertos de plasticos especialmente para el invitado, tienes un lugar en la refrigeradora para tu comida y un anaquel.

Servicio Incluido:
1.- Internet Wi-fi.
2.- Calefaccion.
3.- Agua para tomar.

Prohibiciones: 
1.- No se puede  traer gente ni mascotas al apartamento.
2.- No se hacen fiestas.
3.- No se permiten drogas.
3.- Cuando uses el bano tienes que dejarlo limpio.
4.- Si comes algo tienes que botarlo en la basura de la cocina.
  
Te ofrecemos el mejor servicio, comodidades y ambiente!

name: Halsey Haven  55  - Upbeat Arts District close to NYC
description:
Space is no object in this large two bedroom apartment located in the center of the Downtown Arts District. Restaurants, galleries, theater, NYC Express train, museums, and the Prudential Sports Arena are all within walking distance.

The space
Surrounded by colleges and universities with a great young vibe. Brand New Whole Foods Market directly across the street! Short rides to Newark Airport and Port Liberty! 

Whether you are here for business or pleasure, this large space is ideal for the whole family!

This apartment is fully furnished with free Wifi and a Smart TV with Fire Stick. New living room furniture includes a sleeper sofa. There is a big eat-in kitchen equipped with all the essentials.

There are two bedrooms, each with new queen beds, and an office space with a desk in the larger one. 

Parking not included but there is a pay parking garage across the street.

Pets allowed by request on a case by cas
host_about:
Hosted by RedAwning Vacation Rentals

Welcome to RedAwning, a whole new way to travel. We make staying in a unique home or apartment easier than staying at a hotel. By partnering with local homeowners throughout North America, we provide you with the largest collection of vacation homes in the most destinations. Every stay includes our experienced 24/7 customer assistance by text, chat, email and phone, and access to all your travel details via our free mobile app. We offer consistent terms and flexible cancellation policies, and we include accidental damage protection for every stay with no security deposits and a best rate guarantee. Wherever you want to go, RedAwning is here to make your journey easier!

name: 3bedr Ironbound, power, internet, Airconditnr
description:
You will find yourself in lively & centrally located Bohemian Ironbound district, which is packed with amazing bars, restaurants, clubs, pubs, cafes and nestled between two parks. 8 min bus ride, 15 min walk or short Uber ride to Newark Penn Station, it's 20 mins away from Manhattan. EWR is less than a 10 min drive, $7 on Uber. Prudential, NJ PAC - short ride away. Long/short term stay, next to shopping plaza, grocery, USPS. Convenient to Rutgers, NJIT, hospitals, Merck, TOEFL testing.

The space
3 bedroom apartment newly renovated. One of the bedrooms has a real queen size mattress, 2 single beds are in a second bedroom. Air mattresses can be added to the common areas as needed.
Great for families, groups or single travelers. On street parking. Bus to Penn Station. 40 inch TV, Amazon prime, HBO, Showtime, wifi, Comfortable sectional with a dining table. Great for NYC commute.
If you are traveling by car or planning on renting one, please communic
neighborhood_overview: You will like Ironbound for it's easy commute to the city and abundance of restaurants, local shops, cafes and bars, which are located within walking distance from the house and are fun to visit. Very safe area. I encourage you to do a simple internet search for “Ironbound Newark”.
host_about: We invite you to uncover the hidden side of Newark NJ and stay in one of our historic homes in Forest Hill and Ironbound. Both are truly the NJ best kept secrets - safety, friendly neighbors, 30 min to NYC, 20 mins to EWR. FH offers privacy and surburban feel, while Ironbound is a vibrant, "happening" place. We work in the city and communite to NYC daily, we're both new comers to this country and proximity to the Newark international airport remains very important to us.   As proud homeowners we had them rebuilt and retained a construction company to perform maintenance regularly.  You are welcome to stay with us.

name: Spacious 1 BR near NYC, NWK Penn Station & airport
description:
The house is located in the University Heights section of Newark and is very close to the Newark airport, Rutgers, NJIT and Essex County College. The location is safe with free street parking or a guest 24 hour parking pass can be obtained from security. Whole Foods and Starbucks are downtown or ShopRite can be walked to. Some restaurants are nearby and more options are downtown or in the historic Ironbound section. The house is located steps away from public transportation to Manhattan.

The space
The house has three bedrooms and two and a half bathrooms. The room for guests is spacious with a queen bed (a cot is also available for larger groups) large closet, dresser, desk, TV (Roku stick with Netflix and Hulu) and two windows which let in a lot of natural light when the blackout curtains are drawn.

I live in the master bathroom and have my own full bathroom. The full bathroom in the hallway is shared with only my tenant who occupies the third room.
neighborhood_overview: University Heights is being called the new Brooklyn. The Renaissance of Newark is underway with new restaurants and apartment buildings. The house is located in the heart of where the action is but far enough away from downtown to mimic suburbia. You can enjoy a nice day in the Veterans Memorial Park or head downtown to try out the chic restaurants on Halsey Street. Go see a show at NJPAC or catch a Devils game at the Prudential Center. You also don't want to miss an opportunity to eat at a Brazilian restaurant in the Ironbound section.
host_about: I'm originally from Delaware and have been living in Newark since 2011. I was brought to the area by my desire to work in the media industry (I also didn't mind trading in sleepy Delaware for New York City). I can't live without a good movie (The Graduate is my favorite), music, my faith, my dog Mama and Zumba class.

Alexa, Luis and Little Vida

description:
You will find yourself in lively & centrally located Bohemian Ironbound district, which is packed with amazing bars, restaurants, clubs, pubs, cafes and nestled between two parks. 8 min bus ride, 15 min walk or short Uber ride will take you to Newark Penn Station, it's then just 20 minutes away from Manhattan. EWR is less than a 10 min drive, $7 on Uber. Prudential, NJ Performing Arts Center is a short ride away. Great for long/short term stay, across the street from shopping plaza, grocery

The space
3 bedroom apartment newly renovated. One of the bedrooms has a real queen size mattress, 2 single beds are in a second bedroom. Air mattresses can be added to the common areas as needed.
Great for families, groups or single travelers. On street parking. Bus to Penn Station. 40 inch TV, Amazon prime, HBO, Showtime, wifi, Comfortable sectional with a dining table. Great for NYC commute.
If you are traveling by car or planning on renting one, please com
neighborhood_overview: You will like Ironbound for it's easy commute to the city and abundance of restaurants, local shops, cafes and bars, which are located within walking distance from the house and are fun to visit. Very safe area. I encourage you to do a simple internet search for “Ironbound Newark”.
host_about: We invite you to uncover the hidden side of Newark NJ and stay in one of our historic homes in Forest Hill and Ironbound. Both are truly the NJ best kept secrets - safety, friendly neighbors, 30 min to NYC, 20 mins to EWR. FH offers privacy and surburban feel, while Ironbound is a vibrant, "happening" place. We work in the city and communite to NYC daily, we're both new comers to this country and proximity to the Newark international airport remains very important to us.   As proud homeowners we had them rebuilt and retained a construction company to perform maintenance regularly.  You are welcome to stay with us.

The space
This 900 sq ft (84 sq m) 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment offers all sorts of amenities and comforts making it a truly home away from home experience. The apartment is located on the first floor of a well-kept, quiet residential apartment building in the historic Weequahic neighborhood of Newark, NJ. neighborhood_overview:
Weequahic Park is 1/2 block away. Designed by the Olmsted Brothers firm, Weequahic Park, attracts diverse crowds that enjoys a wide variety of activities playgrounds, jogging trail, 80 acre lake, basketball courts, tennis courts, baseball fields, softball fields, picnic areas and hosts a variety of outdoor concerts and festivals. The park also, contains the first public golf course in New Jersey, expanded to 18-holes.

Sabor Punta Cana, a Dominican cafe, is 0.5 miles away.

King’s Restaurant, a very popular Halal soul food eatery, is 0.7 miles away.

Every day, various food trucks surround Newark Beth Israel Medical Center and the Children’s Hospital of New Jersey. They are parked just four blocks away.
Extra, a supermarket a half a mile away, makes shopping for basic supplies an easy and pleasurable experience.
There are two corner stores located directly across the street for basic needs and comfort packaged food.
The following conven

neighborhood_overview:
The Weequahic park neighborhood is one of Newark's oldest and most pleasant neighborhoods. The area features tree-lined streets, historic, large homes, and easy access to restaurants, shopping, and more. Weequahic park itself was designed by the Olmstead Brothers, the same designers who created Central Park in New York City.

We have owned this house since 2017. Since that time, we have never had any issues with crime or safety, but we encourage you to research the neighborhood online to ensure you will be comfortable and to calibrate your expectations.

neighborhood_overview: Ironbound is a neighborhood in the city of Newark in Essex County, New Jersey, United States. It is a largely working-class, close-knit, multi-ethnic community covering approximately four square miles (10 km²). Historically, the area was called "Dutch Neck," "Down Neck," or simply "the Neck," due to the appearance of the curve of the Passaic River. The Ironbound is part of Newark's East Ward and is directly east of Newark Penn Station and Downtown Newark, and south and west of the river, over which passes the Jackson Street Bridge, connecting to Harrison and Kearny.

Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho

host_about: We invite you to uncover the hidden side of Newark NJ and stay in one of our historic homes in Forest Hill and Ironbound. We work in the city and communite to NYC daily, we're both new comers to this country and proximity to the Newark international airport remains very important to us.   As proud homeowners we had them rebuilt and retained a construction company to perform maintenance regularly.  You are welcome to stay with us.

Located just 3 minutes away from Seton Hall University and 15 minutes away from Newark Liberty International Airport, The Village comfortably accommodates up to 3 individuals.

The space
This guest suite is part of a newly constructed 3 story smart home, which boast features such as smart door locks, nest thermostats, outdoor live view cameras, as well as remote fire alarms, motion sensors and more, monitored by ADT.

Guest access
A personalized key code will be sent to you upon booking, granting you access to this fully stocked guest suite which features 1 bedroom, a living room, a private bathroom and tons of closet space.

Other things to note
We love animals, but NO PETS are allowed, and SMOKING in or around the property is STRICTLY PROHIBITED. To minimize the impact of second-hand smoke on other guests and long-term residents, we have adopted
neighborhood_overview:
This is a 3 story, two-family home with a guest suite, in coveted Upper Vailsburg, Newark. The guest suite or bonus apartment located on the first floor includes a private bathroom, 1 bedroom, a small living room (with a sofa bed and other furniture) and tons of closet space. name: Hidden Gem of Forest Hills/ Mins To Downtown
description:
This is a 1 bedroom, 3rd floor apartment located in a stately brick mansion in the historic section of Newark . Forest Hill gives you suburban living in a quiet, tree-lined area . The apartment has 3 seasons views of New York City skyline, A walk-in closet. Private bathroom. Dining room. Living room and full kitchen. Guest have access to the fenced in backyard which has a covered patio with TV and fire pit. Branch brook park is only 3 blocks away. Come relax for 2 days, a weekend or longer.

The space
If you have trouble with stairs please do not book. The apt is only 20 mins via Bus and approx 12 mins car drive from downtown Newark. Bus stop is located only a stones throw away from the apt. Newark airport is only a 16 mins car ride. Branch Brook Park is only a 5 min walk away.

Guest access
Shared backyard.

Other things to note
★ We do not provide firewood for the fire pit.

There is a early check-in, Late
neighborhood_overview:
A quiet neighborhood nestled against the first county park in the United States, it is minutes to a night at the symphony at Newark's NJPAC, a concert or hockey game at the Prudential Center, an art opening at one of Newark’s many galleries, and dinner and drinks downtown. Forest Hill Newark is the perfect escape for quiet evenings at home while offering access to everything the region has to offer. Just 3 short blocks from the apartment is Branch Book Park, the cherry blossom capital of the US, there are more than 5,000 cherry blossom trees – even more than in Washington, DC! The park has vast open spaces and offers many recreational facilities including ball fields, a 20-court tennis complex, an indoor roller-skating rink, new children’s playgrounds and a visitor center.

Forest Hill Newark must be experienced to be believed!

description:
Stay in a super clean private suite with a queen size bed, office area, spacious closet, and a key locked door. Located in a 1,240 sq ft 3 bedroom condo in the Ironbound neighborhood: 1 block from Newark Riverfront Park, with direct train and express bus service to NYC. Condo has elevator access as well as a private balcony. If this is booked, please take a look at our sister listing in the same unit: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/42794195

The space
Guests have access to a private room and share a bathroom, living room and kitchen. Bathroom includes shampoo, body wash, and a hair dryer. The living room can be used at any time and includes a HDTV and a public desktop computer. The kitchen is equipped with a 4 range stove, microwave, refrigerator, air fryer, Ninja blender, Mr. Coffee maker, and a dishwasher. There is plenty of street parking and secure off street garage parking may be arranged depending on availability.

name: 44 4BR/2BA Entire House Nr NYC Rutgers NJIT Seton
description:
This split-level apartment consists of 4 Bedrooms, 2 Bathrooms, Living Room, Dining Room and Kitchen.
Smart TVs (4), WIFI, Refrigerator, Microwave, and stove are provided.
The kitchen is fully equipped with anything you need.
A washer and dryer are available at additional costs.
My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and big groups.
Parking for over 4 cars behind our home.
Huge bedroom on 3rd floor (Air bed provided for guest 9 and 10th)

The space
Floor 1 - LR, DR, Kitchen
Floor 2 - 3 BRs and full Bath
Floor 3- full Bath and Oversized Bedroom

Note: Washer and Dryer are shared with other separate apartment
1 free wash per week

Guest access

- FREE WiFi internet Unlimited and TV Cable w/ Netflix, Roku etc.
- SmartTVs (4)
- Pack n' play (upon request)
- Door coded - Keyle
host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

description:

The space
Spacious and comfortable ! Everything you'll need for your stay. Next to NYC. Entire apartment available for the guest.

host_about: Born in Nigeria, raised in Brooklyn. I enjoy traveling and trying different dishes. I will choose hard work over talent any day. I am a certified Financial Education Instructor (CFEI). host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!
