neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. name: Kislak 201 Spacious Studio Steps from Everything
description:
Accommodations at the Kislak Building present a modern take on Newark’s historic character, combining contemporary finishes with inviting interiors, providing all the comforts of home to make it a perfect place to stay for business travelers, professionals, extended stay guests, families, or tourists visiting Newark, New York City or the surrounding areas.

These newly renovated one, two, and three-bedroom apartments are an alternative to cramped downtown hotels. Check-in and check-out are handled online with no in-person interaction and each apartment is cleaned and sanitized before your stay. Whole Foods, Prudential, Audible, and Rutgers University are all within a short walking distance.


BUILDING AMENITIES:

* Strength + Cardio Center with Peloton bikes and Virtual Fitness ® open 24hrs
* Complimentary Lockers to temporarily store luggage
* Elevator 
* 6 Floors
* Secured Access 
* Non-Smoking
* Bic
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Newark is a historic district consisting of early 20th-century towers. It contains the central business district and many art deco warehouses and offices that have been converted into residences. Newark offers a wide array of things to do.  There are parks, local and national restaurants, shopping, Museums, the Arts, Sports and a variety of other activities.

The Prudential Center, located in the heart of downtown, is home to the New Jersey Devils, other local sports teams and hosts many national concert tours. Also located in Downtown Newark are the New Jersey Museum of Art and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

From Craft Breweries to specialty local fare, Downtown Newark will not disappoint your hunger and thirst.

There are many events that take place on a year round basis that attracts locals and tourists alike.

If you run out of things to do in Newark, New York City is a 20 minute ride train ride away.

Downtown Newark is a historic district consisting of early 20th-century towers. It contains the central business district and many art deco warehouses and offices that have been converted into residences. Newark offers a wide array of things to do.  There are parks, local and national restaurants, shopping, Museums, the Arts, Sports and a variety of other activities.

The Prudential Center, located in the heart of downtown, is home to the New Jersey Devils, other local sports teams and hosts many national concert tours. Also located in Downtown Newark are the New Jersey Museum of Art and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

From Craft Breweries to specialty local fare, Downtown Newark will not disappoint your hunger and thirst.

There are many events that take place on a year round basis that attracts locals and tourists alike.

If you run out of things to do in Newark, New York City is a 20 minute ride train ride away.

name: Bright room in North Newark Home 15 Mins to EWR
description:
FEMALES ONLY: Welcome to your peaceful and quiet stay. The HUGE bedroom is both neat and spacious with a neat and clean bathroom. Wind down with luxury sheets, chic furnishings, and high end amenities. A 7 min drive or train ride to Penn Station and 14 min drive to EWR.

Area transportation is convenient and fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket.

The space
A clean and peaceful space to work, study, read and explore the neighborhood and the famous Branch Brook Park designed by Central Park architect, William Olmsted.

The bed features a premium Avocado Green mattress and the room has an extra large dresser for clothes and storage.

The stainless steel appliances in the kitchen are all clean and new.

Large living room for relaxing and embracing natural light streaming through
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

neighborhood_overview: Ironbound is a neighborhood in the city of Newark in Essex County, New Jersey, United States. It is a largely working-class, close-knit, multi-ethnic community covering approximately four square miles (10 km²). Historically, the area was called "Dutch Neck," "Down Neck," or simply "the Neck," due to the appearance of the curve of the Passaic River. The Ironbound is part of Newark's East Ward and is directly east of Newark Penn Station and Downtown Newark, and south and west of the river, over which passes the Jackson Street Bridge, connecting to Harrison and Kearny.

neighborhood_overview:
Please go to GOIRONBOUND com to learn more about the neighborhood.

We have been in this neighborhood for over 20 years and seen it develop to a nice, safe, beautiful and diverse neighborhood. It almost feels like NYC, there are lots of restaurants, bars, lounges, clubs, shopping areas, markets etc and almost anything you could think of. Trust us, you won't be disappointed!
host_about:
Let me start by saying, thank you for considering our listings.

We are passionate about the guest experience. We stay in each listing from time to time so we can feel what our guests feel and make sure our guests have the best experience possible. Our improvement to do list is never ending. We take the time to address all of our guests concerns and make their stay as comfortable as possible.

Our company, BESTCITYROOM, com has its own website, IG @ BESTCITYROOM and (Hidden by Airbnb) page BESTCITYROOM where you can find more information about us and reach us for host consulting, Airbnb investments, monetizing Timeshares and doing Airbnb remotely worldwide.

We are always on the move and only a few guests get to know us personally. However, if you would to meet us we will make sure to have you down in our calendar :-)

We have been to many countries and endless cities. We have travel for over 20 years, fluent on 6 languages. There's a big probability we have been to where you come from and have gone where you going next, so feel free to ask for traveling advice.

Thank you for your business and keep traveling/exploring until its your time to rest.

name: Quiet. Comfortable stay. Close to all.
description:
Renovated Motorhome/RV. Immaculate. Sleeps 5 comfortably. 10,000SF secure, quiet property. 5 min walking from conveniences, laundry,
supermarket. To NYC Public transportation (50 min) / Driving within 30 min. Includes: on site parking, pool, fitness area - resistance bands, stability ball, jump ropes, perfect push ups, hand weights, battle rope, 32" smart monitor w/HDMI + remote. Pet friendly (additional $80 for cleaning). Basic needs provided for short term stay. All the best during your stay!

The space
Renovated, modern. RV stay experience without having to hit the road. Property is spacious, open air, country quiet. Yet close to all by public transportation and or personal vehicle. Walk to Branch Brook Park within minutes (it borders the property line).

Guest access
The property is 10,000SF. RV is staged on the property. Within a few steps, you may access the rear fitness deck. Park your car(s) inside the gate during your stay.
neighborhood_overview: 07104 is prime area within Newark. Forest Hills is an uptick from Ditmas Park Brooklyn! Branch Brook park is actually the property line. Within minutes to a serene space to explore. Built by Olmsted (Prospect and Central Park). Basketball, tennis courts, football, soccer, baseball, softball, roller skating rink, fitness areas and clubs within minutes. Buses and light rails within minutes. Newark Penn Station within 15 minutes. NYC Penn within 20 minutes from Newark Penn. This area is country quiet and easily accessible to downtown Newark, Newark airport, major malls + box stores within minutes, Walmart, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, and more. NYC very close. The view from 07104 to Manhattan rivals that of Brooklyn - just on the other side of the buildings. We recently rented out some of the apartments ... the majority of applicants were NYC based. Lots of bang for the dollar here without too much compromise. Enjoy!

Close to food franchises, Supermarkets, nightlife, shopping areas, family-friendly activities, public transport and the airport.

The space

Explore
neighborhood_overview:
Some of the reviews about the neighborhood are old.
The area is safe. There are few bad folks like in every big city.
The area is being revitalized.
People around here are friendly. Don't be surprised if someone says "Good morning" or tries to help you.
Take a tour around Newark by doing a search on "City of Newark tax collector NJ". You will see a street view map. Please click on it and take a virtual tour.
host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

name: Serene & Peaceful Room Near Penn EWR & Attractions
description:
FEMALES ONLY: Welcome to your peaceful and quiet stay. The HUGE bedroom is both neat and spacious with a neat and clean bathroom. Wind down with luxury sheets, chic furnishings, and high end amenities. A 7 min drive or train ride to Penn Station and 14 min drive to EWR.

Area transportation is convenient and fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket.

The space
A clean and peaceful space to work, study, read and explore the neighborhood and the famous Branch Brook Park designed by Central Park architect, William Olmsted.

The room has a large dress rack with hangars for hanging clothes and storage.

The stainless steel appliances in the kitchen are all clean and new.

Large living room for relaxing and embracing natural light streaming through the large window.

The fem
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

description:

Get a good nights sleep on our memory foam mattresses, cook in our new kitchen with all new appliances. The icing on the cake is that this apartment offers a private home office & high speed WiFi, the ultimate work from home setup for video conferencing or virtual school. Right on the border of Newark & South Orange.

The space
Enjoy time together in the living room or dine with your family or friends in our dining room with a picturesque stained glass window. Connected to the dining room, is our all white kitchen with stainless steel appliances and everything you need to make a meal except edibles.
This apartment has lots of character and offers 3 bedrooms, 2 with comfy Queen size beds. Our best kept secret is right off of the living room through quaint French doors, its our Sunlight fille
neighborhood_overview:
This home is right on the Newark South Orange border. Seton Hall University is steps away making it a perfect place to stay if you are visiting the School. The VA Medical center is close by. It is also only an 8 min drive to downtown South Orange where you can enjoy restaurants, cafes . This home gives you access to the best of both Worlds. Parks, Museums, Shopping Malls are all a short drive.
Plus! jump on the NJ Transit train to New York City from the South Orange Train Station only a 3 min drive away.
host_about: Family first. Love traveling and sharing our home with you.

name: Huge Bright Rm with Closet 7 Min Drive to Nwk Penn
description:
FEMALES ONLY: Welcome to your peaceful and quiet stay. The HUGE bedroom is both neat and spacious with a neat and clean bathroom. Wind down with luxury sheets, chic furnishings, and high end amenities. A 7 min drive or train ride to Penn Station and 14 min drive to EWR.

Area transportation is convenient and fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket.

The space
A clean and peaceful space to work, study, read and explore the neighborhood and two blocks away, the famous Branch Brook Park designed by Central Park architect, William Olmsted.

The bedroom is oversized with ample room for spreading out and storing luggage and clothing in the HUGE closet.

The full-size mattress is a luxury Tempur Pedic 'Kool Flow' mattress that redirects your body heat so you stay cool and comfortable at night.
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

name: #9 Perfect runaway Newark ISRAEL BETH HOSPITAL
description:
Perfect place to visit NYC and Newark! Welcome all long term reseravations for medical students and professionals. Good neighberhood!! Just renovated house. Newark airport 2,5 mile!!! 3 minutes walk (0.2 mile) to bus going straight to Manhattan New York port authority (10 stops-32 min). Just in front of Israel Beth Hospital. Prudential Center 3 Miles away.
Edit

Guest access
NO PARTIES ALLOWED! No smoking allowed!
If more people entering a house that it’s on reservation it’s subject for cancelation

Other things to note
NO SMOKING inside the house and room with a fee of $100
I dont offer private parking but you can park on street for FREE just make sure to watch signs. Restrictions: Can’t park on my side of street on Tue 8am-12 pm. Can’t park oposite side of my street on Mon 8am-12 pm.
No parties! No guests and gatherings.
If booked for 2 people only 2 can stay.
If entering more reservation is not valid

name: Kislak 305 Luxurious 1BR in Heart of Downtown
description:
Accommodations at the Kislak Building present a modern take on Newark’s historic character, combining contemporary finishes with inviting interiors, providing all the comforts of home to make it a perfect place to stay for business travelers, professionals, extended stay guests, families, or tourists visiting Newark, New York City or the surrounding areas.

These newly renovated one, two, and three-bedroom apartments are an alternative to cramped downtown hotels. Check-in and check-out are handled online with no in-person interaction and each apartment is cleaned and sanitized before your stay. Whole Foods, Prudential, Audible, and Rutgers University are all within a short walking distance.


BUILDING AMENITIES:

* Strength + Cardio Center with Peloton bikes and Virtual Fitness ® open 24hrs
* Complimentary Lockers to temporarily store luggage
* Elevator 
* 6 Floors
* Secured Access 
* Non-Smoking
* Bic
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Newark is a historic district consisting of early 20th-century towers. It contains the central business district and many art deco warehouses and offices that have been converted into residences. Newark offers a wide array of things to do.  There are parks, local and national restaurants, shopping, Museums, the Arts, Sports and a variety of other activities.

The Prudential Center, located in the heart of downtown, is home to the New Jersey Devils, other local sports teams and hosts many national concert tours. Also located in Downtown Newark are the New Jersey Museum of Art and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

From Craft Breweries to specialty local fare, Downtown Newark will not disappoint your hunger and thirst.

There are many events that take place on a year round basis that attracts locals and tourists alike.

If you run out of things to do in Newark, New York City is a 20 minute ride train ride away.

Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

name: 44 1C Entire Mini Studio near NYC and EWR
description:
This apartment consists of Bedroom and LR/Dining room and Kitchen area combined and a bathroom. No sharing...
Please disregard bad review by a previous guest. We provide excellent support and safety.
This is a finished basement with a height of about 6.3 feet. Do not book if you are taller than 6 feet. .

My place is close the airport, nightlife, and public transport.

The space
Some of the highlights are:
- FREE WiFi internet Unlimited and TV Cable w/ Netflix, Roku etc.
- SmartTV (1)
- Pack n' play (upon request)
- Door coded - Keyless entry 24 hours a day
- Refrigerator
- Microwave
- Coffee maker
- Washer and Dryer
- Plates, cup and utensils
- Fresh bath towels, hand towels, face towels
- Free parking at the back of the property
- Wine and champagne glasses upon requests
- 100 mbps internet speed

Other things to note
Please read the follow
host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

Each bedroom boasts the highest quality queen bed and ultra plush linens. A fully appointed chef's kitchen will make this the perfect place to Sojourn. Fully renovated in 2021, we invite you to experience this high class home built specifically with a traveler's needs in mind.

The space
All Sojourn cleaners are certified in cleaning practices based on guidelines from The World Health Organization, Center for Disease Control and Prevention, US Occupational Safety and Health Administration, and the US Food and Drug Administration.

Sojourn, A Turnkey Luxury Experience. We’ve hosted over 10,000 guests in 50+ spaces with an average rating of 4.8 stars. Each space is handpicked, in unbeatable locations and is designed and run by us. A Sojourn space is carefully curated, thoughtfully designed,
neighborhood_overview:
Located west of the downtown area, University Heights is—true to its name—a partially residential hub of higher learning in Newark, New Jersey. Residents of this urban community enjoy convenient access to the wealth of shopping, dining and entertainment options available in Downtown Newark, as well as proximity to universities and colleges, including the New Jersey Institute of Technology, Essex County College, and a section of the Rutgers University Newark Campus

Go for a morning stroll or jog at Veterans Memorial Park. Visit the Feigenspan Mansion to see one of the last surviving examples of Second Renaissance Revival architecture in Newark. Set your sights to the stars with fascinating exhibits and dazzling celestial shows at Dreyfuss Planetarium. Experience New Jersey’s take on Southern comfort food like Mac n’ Cheese, Collard Greens, and Vonda’s Famous Famous Bean Dip at Vonda’s Kitchen. Turn up the heat with some BBQ Jamaican Jerk Jumbo Chicken Wings on the patio at Re
host_about: Hi, I'm Nicole, the co-founder of Sojourn.  At Sojourn, we understand how being away from home and routine can be disruptive to your being, which is why we have made our raison d’etre about making your temporary stay seamless and fluid. We are, at our core, about hospitality! A Sojourn space is carefully curated, thoughtfully designed, complete with beautiful and comfortable furniture. You will find fully equipped kitchens, superior quality mattresses, high quality linens and luxury towels. We have built Sojourn around understanding your unique needs and expectations. We can and will cater our services to ensure that you have everything you need to settle in and enjoy your Sojourn.

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

From Newark Penn Station, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

neighborhood_overview:
Newark International Airport is 10 minutes away & train station is 5 minutes away.

Several eateries are within walking distance, as well as a supermarket & dollar-type store. Other shopping areas & Malls are less than 15-30 mins away by car or you can take a bus/train from Newark Penn Station which is located 11mins away by car.

Rutgers University, Newark Museum, and several restaurants are a 5 - 10 minute drive.

Turtleback Zoo is a 15 min drive. Six Flaggs Great Adventure is 1hr drive. The Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park is a 25 min. drive

The Jersey shore (with several benches & boardwalks) is within a 1-2 hours drive. Atlantic City is a 1hr & 45 mins.drive.

Located a block away is 1 of New Jersey's number 1 hospitals & trauma centers.

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho

The Newark resurgence is in full swing and it's evident in this Downtown neighborhood. You're steps to a 24 hour pancake house, farm to table soul food restaurant, vegan restaurant and just a few blocks away catch your favorite pop star in concert, cheer on the local pro hockey team, or enjoy a performance by world renowned musicians and theatre companies.

Local restaurants to suit every vibe are within walking distance. Take a self guided walking tour of up and coming artist communities and enjoy the large street murals popping up all over Downtown.

Enjoy the beautiful architecture of historic buildings that are all across the city or stop by the federal courthouse to admire the massive statue of Lady Justice. Newark is THE place to be!

The space

The bedroom is oversized with ample room for spreading out and storing luggage and clothing in the HUGE closet.

The stainless steel appliances in the kitchen are all clean and new.

Enjoy the large living room for relaxing and embracing natural
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to historic Forest Hills neighborhood, an architecturally eclectic, vibrant, neighborhood in Newark, NJ. Steps away from all the best shops, cafes, bakeries, bars, and local eateries that Newark has to offer!

Centralized location to all major highways (280, 21, 3, GSP). Very close to the new American Dream Mall and also Met Life Stadium! Just hop on 21 to 3 and be there in 10-15 minutes. Be in NYC in less than 30 minutes from Newark Penn Station!
host_about:
Hello! I'm Brent and I'm married to Stephanie for 8 years. My wife was born and raised in Newark, New Jersey and I was born in Florida! We love traveling, Airbnb, and meeting people just like you!

Feel free to book or message me first if you have any specific questions.

By day I am a licensed realtor and by night I am a Bob Dylan fanatic.

We are both well-traveled Airbnb guests as well, so we have learned precisely what a host should do to create a comfortable and memorable guest experience.

name: Kislak 503 Luxurious 2BR Retreat Above the City
description:
Accommodations at the Kislak Building present a modern take on Newark’s historic character, combining contemporary finishes with inviting interiors, providing all the comforts of home to make it a perfect place to stay for business travelers, professionals, extended stay guests, families, or tourists visiting Newark, New York City or the surrounding areas.




These newly renovated one, two, and three-bedroom apartments are an alternative to cramped downtown hotels with the added convenience of having the ability to customize apartments to guests' needs ( contact management office for options). Check-in and check-out are handled online with no in-person interaction and each apartment is cleaned and sanitized before your stay. Newark Penn Station is a short way away giving you easy access to New York City, the Jersey Shore, and area attractions via NJ Transit or PATH.  Whole Foods, Starbucks, Prudential, Audible, NJIT, Seton Hall Law, University Hospital-Newar
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Newark is a historic district consisting of early 20th-century towers. It contains the central business district and many art deco warehouses and offices that have been converted into residences. Newark offers a wide array of things to do.  There are parks, local and national restaurants, shopping, Museums, the Arts, Sports and a variety of other activities.

The Prudential Center, located in the heart of downtown, is home to the New Jersey Devils, other local sports teams and hosts many national concert tours. Also located in Downtown Newark are the New Jersey Museum of Art and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

From Craft Breweries to specialty local fare, Downtown Newark will not disappoint your hunger and thirst.

There are many events that take place on a year round basis that attracts locals and tourists alike.

If you run out of things to do in Newark, New York City is a 20 minute ride train ride away.

name: Kislak B001 Chic Studio with Private Patio Steps from Everything
description:
Accommodations at the Kislak Building present a modern take on Newark’s historic character, combining contemporary finishes with inviting interiors, providing all the comforts of home to make it a perfect place to stay for business travelers, professionals, extended stay guests, families, or tourists visiting Newark, New York City, or the surrounding areas. With Newark Penn Station a short walk away, guests have access to New York City, Jersey City, Hoboken, the Jersey Shore, and most area attractions, via NJ Transit or PATH trains

These newly renovated one, two, and three-bedroom apartments are an alternative to cramped downtown hotels. Check-in and check-out are handled online with no in-person interaction and each apartment is cleaned and sanitized before your stay.  Area shopping includes Whole Foods, Starbucks, Nike Store.  Local companies such as Panasonic, Mars Wrigley, Prudential, and Audible are all within walking distance, as is Seton Hall Law, NJIT, University
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Newark is a historic district consisting of early 20th-century towers. It contains the central business district and many art deco warehouses and offices that have been converted into residences. Newark offers a wide array of things to do.  There are parks, local and national restaurants, shopping, Museums, the Arts, Sports and a variety of other activities.

The Prudential Center, located in the heart of downtown, is home to the New Jersey Devils, other local sports teams and hosts many national concert tours. Also located in Downtown Newark are the New Jersey Museum of Art and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

From Craft Breweries to specialty local fare, Downtown Newark will not disappoint your hunger and thirst.

There are many events that take place on a year round basis that attracts locals and tourists alike.

If you run out of things to do in Newark, New York City is a 20 minute ride train ride away.

description:
FEMALES ONLY: Welcome to your peaceful and quiet stay. The cozy bedroom is both neat and spacious with a neat and clean bathroom. Wind down with luxury sheets, chic furnishings, and high end amenities. A 7 min drive or train ride to Penn Station and 14 min drive to EWR.

Area transportation is convenient and fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket.

The space
A clean and peaceful space to work, study, read and explore the neighborhood and the famous Branch Brook Park designed by Central Park architect, William Olmsted.

The room has a large dress rack with hangars for hanging clothes and storage.

The stainless steel appliances in the kitchen are all clean and new.

Large living room for relaxing and embracing natural light streaming through the large window.

The fema
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

name: The Lennox Stay -  2 King Beds ☆Close to EWR
description:
Beautiful 2 bed/2 bath apartment located in a brand new luxury building in the heart of the City of Newark. Our place comes fully furnished and has an extensive list of amenities to ensure that your time here truly feels like home away from home.

The apartment is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized between each stay by a professional cleaning team using Airbnb's 5 step enhanced cleaning process.

The space
Your stay will include the stylish furnished apartment, with full sized kitchen and 2 bathrooms. We have designed the space for families traveling together to have a space that is comfortable and cozy. This includes TV's in each room and living room, and a desk to make it easy to work or do schoolwork.

Other building amenities include a gym, a lounge and one optional paid garage parking spot.
neighborhood_overview:
Located within a 5 minute walk of Newark’s Prudential Center and just a few minutes from the Newark Performing Arts center, this is the perfect location for any sports and concert enthusiasts. Also perfect for those travelers looking to visit NYC, which is a short 25 minute train ride away or a 40 minute drive.

Also located about a 15 minute drive from Newark Liberty International (EWR) Airport.

Perfect for families visiting the American Dream Mall and Nickelodeon Theme Park.

Please also note that the apartment is located in a busy up and coming area and there is potential for outside noise.
host_about: My wife and I are hard working professionals that enjoy spending time with friends and family. Traveling and getting to explore different parts of the world has always been one of our favorite pastimes. Whether hosting or traveling, or experiencing different cultures & events ,we always make the best of it!

neighborhood_overview:
Located west of the downtown area, University Heights is—true to its name—a partially residential hub of higher learning in Newark, New Jersey. Residents of this urban community enjoy convenient access to the wealth of shopping, dining and entertainment options available in Downtown Newark, as well as proximity to universities and colleges, including the New Jersey Institute of Technology, Essex County College, and a section of the Rutgers University Newark Campus

Go for a morning stroll or jog at Veterans Memorial Park. Visit the Feigenspan Mansion to see one of the last surviving examples of Second Renaissance Revival architecture in Newark. Set your sights to the stars with fascinating exhibits and dazzling celestial shows at Dreyfuss Planetarium. Experience New Jersey’s take on Southern comfort food like Mac n’ Cheese, Collard Greens, and Vonda’s Famous Famous Bean Dip at Vonda’s Kitchen. Turn up the heat with some BBQ Jamaican Jerk Jumbo Chicken Wings on the patio at Re

We are, at our core, about hospitality! A Sojourn space is carefully curated, thoughtfully designed, complete with beautiful and comfortable furniture. You will find fully equipped kitchens, superior quality mattresses, high quality linens and luxury towels. We have built Sojourn around understanding your unique needs and expectations. We can and will cater our services to ensure that you have everything you need to settle in and enjoy your Sojourn.

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho

Located in Ironbound, the Portuguese/Brazilian neighborhood of Newark, and just 13-min away by foot from Newark Penn Station, this studio-basement apartment offers all the necessary amenities to make your stay comfortable and relaxing.
Want to get to New York City? Hop on the NJ Transit or the reliable PATH Train and whisk away to Jersey City in 15min or to New York City in 20min.

The Ironbound is known for its Portuguese/Brazilian community. Ferry street that spans provides multiple restaurants, bars and shops. But don't just stay on this part of town. Harrison is also another town that can be reached via Jackson Street Bridge, if you brave it by foot.

Transportation is convenient + fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket

The space
There are tons of cultural restaurants, delis, and supermarkets nearby.

The bed features a luxury mattress and the room has an extra large dresser for clothes and storage.

The appliances in the kitchen are all clean and new.

The bathroom is cleaned and *shared*.

We love to welcome guests that are ambitious; love healthy and clean living; meditation; yoga; working out; joyful; passionate; tolerant and accepting
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

The apartment: walk up the stairs upon opening door 3 and you are dazzled by tons of bright LED lights in the rows of recessed lighting throughout
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to historic Forest Hills neighborhood, an architecturally eclectic, vibrant, neighborhood in Newark, NJ. Steps away from all the best shops, cafes, bakeries, bars, and local eateries that Newark has to offer!

Centralized location to all major highways (280, 21, 3, GSP). Very close to the new American Dream Mall and also Met Life Stadium! Just hop on 21 to 3 and be there in 10-15 minutes. Be in NYC in less than 30 minutes from Newark Penn Station!
host_about:
Hello! I'm Brent and I'm married to Stephanie for 8 years. My wife was born and raised in Newark, New Jersey and I was born in Florida! We love traveling, Airbnb, and meeting people just like you!

Feel free to book or message me first if you have any specific questions.

By day I am a licensed realtor and by night I am a Bob Dylan fanatic.

We are both well-traveled Airbnb guests as well, so we have learned precisely what a host should do to create a comfortable and memorable guest experience.

We have two wonderful kids and two hairless sphynx cats. We enjoy health & fitness, music & the arts, and spending the day on the beach.

Come stay with us today!

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

From Newark Penn Station, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

description:
Welcome to your peaceful and quiet stay. The HUGE bedroom is both neat and spacious with a neat and clean bathroom. Wind down with luxury sheets, an organic full size mattress, and high end amenities. A 7 min drive or train ride to Penn Station and 14 min drive to EWR.

Area transportation is convenient and fast. We are located 2 blocks from the Park Ave Train Station; 1 block from Dunkin Donuts, KFC, Dominican restaurant, laundromat, cleaners, and 2 delis; and 5 min walk to BRAVO Supermarket.

The space
A clean and peaceful space to work, study, read and explore the neighborhood and two blocks away, the famous Branch Brook Park designed by Central Park architect, William Olmsted.

This is a 2 bedroom / 1 bathroom lower level apartment (ceiling height is 6 feet).

The bedroom is oversized with ample room for spreading out and storing luggage and working with the good sized desk.

The bed features the eco-friendly organic Ede
neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

From Newark Penn Station, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. name: Lovely Fully Renovated 2- bedroom Apt. Newark/NYC
description:
Come stay in a stylish newly renovated basement-floor apartment right outside NYC! This Luxurious Newly Renovated Apartment is the ideal place for your visit whether it is for business, family, or for a self-rejuvenating getaway. It's an apartment perfect for all occasions. The apartment is a 1-2 minute walk to a convenient supermarket, laundromat, bus routes (94, 1), and liquor store. You are 14 minutes away from Newark Intl Airport, and 15 minutes away from Newark Penn Station.

Other things to note
You cannot receive mail or packages to this airbnb apartment.

Should you need a late checkout, please request a day or days before your checkout. Late checkout will cost $50 if and when accommodated.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is on a nice busy safe street with a convenient supermarket, laundromat, liquor store, pharmacy, and post office all 1-2 mins walkable. The backyard is serene and boasts a suburban feel. It is on the border of several towns with dozens of amazing restaurants all 10-15 minutes away. The 1 and 94 buses are both 1 min walks away.

MEDICAL STUDENT/VISITING STUDY FRIENDLY! Please contact us for a special rate.

name: Lovely 3-Bedroom Apt. 5 miles  from Newark Airport
description:
Forget your worries in this spacious and serene space located in a safe, family-oriented, quiet neighborhood.

You have the entire 3-bedrm, 2 bthrm apt. located on the 2nd-flr of a 3 family home.

Tourist Attractions, Malls/Shopping Centers, Restaurants/Fast-food/Eateries, Level-1 Trauma Center Hospital, Rutgers University - Newark Campus, NJIT, Seton Hall Law School, Transportation Hub, Gym & access to all NJ major highways are all within 2 - 30 minute drive away.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located on a safe, quiet, family-oriented one-way street.

The neighborhood has a Level 1 Trauma Center & Hospital down the block from the apartment and pharmacies very close in either direction.

You will find plenty of eating choices within a 3-mile radius. More eating choices are located in the Downtown or Iron Bound Section of Newark which is 5-10 miles away.

The apartment has access to a washer&dryer on the main landing of the house that is shared with the 3rd-floor apartment but if you want to get your laundry done quicker, a laundromat is located 1 mile away.
host_about: I am ex-military now working both a full & part time job. Been on my fully time job for 24 years. I love to travel, read and solve hard puzzles. Proud grandmother of 2 Angels that are my whole world. I love people who love life & know how to treat people with respect.

The space
Newly furnished one bedroom apartment. This apartment features a mixed decor of mid century modern and contemporary styles. It consists of an open living/dining/kitchen space, a spacious bedroom with closet, and full bath.

The kitchen is equipped with a new stovetop and microwave, as well as, all your kitchen essentials including air fryer, rice cooker, and toaster. One of the m
neighborhood_overview:
Everything is close by!! Lots of restaurants, laundromats, convenience stores, barbershops, USPS, gas stations, and more, all within walking distance.

5 min drive to Branch Brook Park, house of the largest collection of Cherry Blossom trees in the USA. Also, 5 min to University Heights, Prudential Center, NJPAC, and 25 min drive to NYC.

We have been living in this neighborhood for over 10 years and we love to see the City growing. Although the neighborhood is busy, it is safe. It is an active neighborhood and you may hear noises such as cars, sirens, and perhaps some music from the restaurant down the block.
host_about:
Hello!! My name is Angie!

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h

host_about:
Hi  This is Mario!    

Look no further... 
We have an excellent support team for great stays  and nice places! 
We add new things  weekly...

I made it from NYC (Port Authority 8th Ave and 42 Street to Irvington with bus # 107X in 20 minutes when there is little traffic. 

Also,  We provide excellent WiFi and 2 WIFI networks at each house.

You may want to try downloading ROKU app for use on our Roku smart TVs.

We use door codes.  No keys needs.
We change codes after each guest leaves.

I'm giving you $5 off each of your first 4 Uber rides. To accept, use code 'marioc2038ue' to sign up. Enjoy! Details:  uber site  and  invite  and marioc2038ue

I'm originally from Costa Rica.   My Grand parents moved from Jamaica to  Limon, Costa Rica to work on building a railroad  to San Jose 100 years ago.
Limon and Costa Rica are very friendly places.  So, is Irvington, NJ, USA.

We love to provide excellent service and to excel in everything we do.

If we please you, tell many friends...If we miss our goal, please tell me..
:)  :)  :)

 I love to make new friends, good food, to explore new places and have fun.    
Please contact me if you are planning to explore NYC, NJ,  or Costa Rica.
 
We will have a great time.... Once you are here...You are family!

If you fly into Newark Airport (EWR) and staying at least 7 days,  Book an UBER or Lyft taxi and send photo of bill for refund (Up to $10).   

Also, I love to ski ...Poconos Skiing resort is 50 minutes away.  You can learn  to Ski ,Snowboard, or just slide down the slopes here!!!

Thanks!!!

description:

The apartment consists with 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, a nice living room and a complete kitchen with all appliances you may need to prepare your meals. Very well located 30 minutes drive to Manhattan, great walking distances to restaurants and supermarkets. We offer a complementary parking space with a local parking lot there opening hours 8am to 11pm

The space
Very spacious apartment, kitchen was fully redone with a beautiful butcher block counter top, touch-less faucet, plenty of storage space, and a very special coffee area with a Keurig and expresso machine, living room is very cozy with a comfortable couch, coffee table, smart TV, and a cool victrola. Bedroom 1st is very spacious with lots of windows a queen size bed, nice closet and really nice reading lamps. 2nd bedroom has a double twin bed.

All guest will receive discount and voucher from local busine
neighborhood_overview: We are located on the heart of the ironbound section of Newark, just by simply walking on Ferry Street anyone can “travel the world” and have a unique experience, there are many bars & restaurant on which guests can taste the best from diferente cuisines such as Portuguese, Brazilian & Spanish. We are only a 20 min walk from the Red Bull Soccer Arena and The Harrison Station that within minutes can take anyone to Manhattan NYC. Another option to get to NYC would be the Newark Penn Station. We are also just 20 min from the prudential center home for the New Jersey Devils and host for lots of great concerts. If you are a football fan the home for the New York Giants and New York Jets (MetLife Stadium) is only 10 miles away, and next door to MetLife we have the famous American Dream Mall the 2nd biggest mall in the USA and if you are traveling with kids the family can enjoy the memorable Nickelodeon universe team park. Another option for the shopping enthusiastic is the Jersey garden mall

name: Cozy Suite by Prudential Ctr & 7 min to EWR Airpt
description:
Welcome to this thoughtfully decorated basement studio space that lives on a quiet neighborhood. While this cozy place is equipped with comfort, entertainment (e.g. board games, streaming video/cable device), and culinary tools, its location makes it easy to get around. You are only:

-3 min walking distance to the Prudential Ctr Arena
-7 min drive to Newark Intl Airport
-10 min walking distance to Newark Symphony Halls
-30 min walk with train ride to Penn St NYC
-And so much more!

The space
Every aspect of this studio has been artfully designed to bring luxury and life to this remodeled cozy studio space.

While this studio is equipped to host 2 people, we think the perfect size is 3.

Is that a cloud you're sleeping on? Nope, that's just the memory foam mattress on that full sized bed.

The leather couch can be pulled out for that 3rd person.

Basic cooking ingredients and culinar
neighborhood_overview:
Charming quiet neighborhood that is only WALKING distance to a myriad of American and ethnic restaurants, including:

Indian
Thai
Portuguese (e.g. well renowned Don Pepe)
Brazilian
Spanish
Japanese
Soul food
Nigerian
Kenyan
American (e.g. Urban Vegan, The Yard, The Dutch's Restaurant)
And so much more!

Additional activities to do nearby:

-Enjoy a riveting performance at the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.

-Explore well curated artwork at the Newark Museum of Art.

-Gaze in wonder at the astronomical features and night sky on the dome shaped ceiling at the Dreyfuss Planetarium.

-Enjoy poignant rotating exhibits at the culturally treasured Jewish Museum of New Jersey.

-Enjoy stadium seating as you watch your favorite movie on an all-digital movie screen at the City Plex, a theater co-owned by the NBA legend Shaquille O’Neal.


And if you're loo
host_about:
Hello there! My name is Joy, and I'm originally from NYC. 

I enjoy meeting new people, and familiarizing myself with different kinds of cultures. I am passionate about ethnic cuisine (e.g. Indian, Thai, and Nigerian food), art, and medicine. I am obsessed with traveling (domestic and international), and have gone on a solo back-packing trip  to Western Europe where I visited 10 cities, and 9 countries. neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

From Newark Penn Station, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

name: ☆NEW☆Duplex Near NYC+Sleeps 16+ Breakfast Included
description:
Welcome to Suite:Jersey! Our breath-taking, newly remodeled duplex boasts style, comfort & is designed for large group travel. Located 30 min from Times Sq. NYC & we’re Event + Family Friendly!

Our duplex is PERFECT for a weekend getaway, slumber party, bridal suite, or family reunion!

Why choose to stay with us?

✔Breakfast Included
✔Prvt office+ Peleton
✔Hosts up to 25
✔7 Min- Newark Airport
✔2 Blocks- Express Bus to NYC+Park w/ Lake
✔15 min- Met Life Stadium/Prudential Ctr/NJPAC/Dream Mall

The space
Built in the 1900’s, our 3 story house is a sophisticated blend of original & modern touches, all dipped in a bold black hue. It was specifically designed and curated with large group travel in mind.

*Video Tour Available By Request

Why Suite:Jersey?

✔️Reputable & Highly Rated Host w/ Over 65 Reviews

✔Double the Space, Double the Fun: TWO Floors, TWO Living roo
neighborhood_overview:
The duplex is located in the Weequahic neighborhood of Newark, NJ.

•》Just a short drive from Newark Penn Station, Prudential Center, NJ Performing Arts Center, MetLife Stadium, Nickolodean at Dream Mall, art and museums downtown.

•》Located less than two blocks from Weequahic Park, home to 311 acres of lush green space.

• 》Weequahic Park was designed by Olmstead, known for designing some of the world’s most famous parks that includes NYC’s Central Park and Brooklyn’s Prospect Park

•》The park has the world’s longest resilient-surfaced (100% recycled rubber) track which wraps around a beautiful 80 acre lake, with fountain and 18 hole golf course

•》Newark, NJ is rich in history, home to the state’s largest museum and the largest port on the east coast.
host_about:
myCitySuite is a boutique short-term rental company offering both vacation rentals and event spaces.

Born out of a love for people & fashion, a taste for comfort, & an eye for design, we aim to provide our guests with a unique experience, one that lasts.

Check out our newest location on Maps and social! @SuiteJersey

*Video Tour Available By Request

About the Founder:

Defina helps to sculpt the NYC skyline for a living. Essentially, she puts up the steel structure of buildings & bridges. This has created in her, a fixation on city skylines across the world!

From cross country road trips to snorkeling in Cuba, her love for discovering new places & new experiences keeps life exciting.

She enjoys meeting new people, music, interior design, education, & fashion. When she is not putting up a new building or repairing one of NY's iconic bridges, she is out exploring her interests or indulging in some quality time with her daughters.

From Defina and the myCitySuite team, we welcome you to create memories with purpose and experience travel with style!

neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in Downtown Newark one of the best and safest parts of Newark. Anyone who feels comfortable in big cities- like Brooklyn, Chicago, Washington DC, NYC will feel right at home here. This is a relatively safe area, but as with any urban area you have to take proper precautions (e.g. don't walk alone at night, don't leave doors open, don't leave packages or valuables in outside plain site., etc.)

Downtown Newark is host to Prudential Stadium, NJPAC , restaurants, bars, and so much more. Come experience the cultural center of Newark. Walk to grocery stores, post office, restaurants, entertainment- all you need is walking distance or quick car/bus ride.

House is around the corner from Lincoln Park- where music festivals are held in the summer.

name: Lovely 3-Bedroom Rental close to Beth Isreal Hosp
description:
This spacious and stylish place to stay is perfect for group trips. Relax in this spacious newly renovated 3 bedroom nurse-only apartment on the 2nd floor of a well maintained 2-family home. Get a good nights sleep on our brand new memory foam mattress, cook in our full kitchen with all the appliances you need. The apartment offers free high speed WiFi and free utilities. This home is located in the Weequahic section of Newark. Please research the area before booking, if you are not familiar.

The space
Professional cleaners clean and disinfect after each guest. Plus we block 24 hours between each guest. You also have access to a separate washer and dryer in the basement in a shared laundry area. This is the perfect place to stay that meets your needs, so we ask that you please treat this house as if it was your own. In the unlikely event that you damage anything in the apartment, please let us know in advance so that we have time to fix it for the next guests.
neighborhood_overview: We are in a safe neighborhood. This home is right off of Lyons Avenue, close to Newark Beth Isreal Hospital. We are also minutes from Newark Airport. A short 2 min walk takes you to the bus stop right on Lyons Avenue, where you can hop on a NJ transit bus to Beth Isreal Hospital, a 3 min ride or to New York City which is a 45 min ride away.
host_about: Family first. Love traveling and sharing our home with you.

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and ho
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. There are lots of public transportation close by (trains and buses) as well as places to grab a bite. Don't hesitate to reach out: we look forward to hearing from you and hosting you!

Whether alone, with family, or with friends, you’ll be close to everything and in need of nothing when you stay at this centrally-located, family & pet-friendly condo with a washer/dryer in the unit!

Close to historic landmarks, parks, restaurants, outlet malls, grocery stores, and public transportation, w/ 24-hour security and ample parking, what's preventing you from booking?!

The space
Super cozy condo, quaint and private. This space is ideal for anyone looking to explore north Jersey and its surrounding areas or just in need of some private space.

Universities

~ Rutgers Newark
~ NJIT
~ Bloomfield College
~ Seton Hall

Transportation

~ Newark Penn Station (10 mins)
~ Newark Liberty Airport (20 mins)
~ Jersey City (25 mins)
~ Hoboken (25 mins)
~ New York

Educator | Traveler | Child of the Universe | 

Peace and Blessings to you,

I’m Fatima and I own this cozy and quaint  condo you’re about to take a peep at. I’m an Educator by profession and Explorer by nature.

Be well!

name: Adorable 1-bedroom Guesthouse with Patio
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located home in a quiet residential neighborhood.

The space
The guesthouse is located in the backyard of the main house, in a private setting. It is accessed through a locked gate. It consists of an open living/dining/kitchen space, a bedroom (no windows in bedroom), a full bath, and a laundry room. The patio space has a table and chairs for outdoor dining. This is a private home separate from the main home. Patio is shared with tenant from the main house who occasionally uses the grill.

We provide a fully stocked kitchen. Bed and bath linens. Just bring your personal belongings, toiletries and food.

The Ironbound section of Newark is a vibrant community of immigrants (predominantly Portuguese, Spanish, Brazilian as well as other central and south American cultures), with amazing restaurants and markets within walking distance of the home.

Newark Pen Station with train service to NYC

neighborhood_overview:
Newark is the Garden State’s largest metropolis and is located just 8 short miles from Manhattan. Air, water, roadway, railway, bike path, footbridge and subway, Newark offers every manner of transportation imaginable, providing access that’s unbelievable.

The transportation in the Roseville neighborhood is super convenient! After taking the light rail to Newark Penn Station 2 blocks away, its only a 20 minute commute to Midtown, NYC by train.

For entertainment, the New Jersey Performing Arts Center (NJPAC). Take on the largest premium outlet mall in the state, The Outlet Collection, Jersey Gardens, welcoming over 18 million visitors a year. Other activities include the Newark Museum; NHL New Jersey Devils; and NCAA Seton Hall Men’s Basketball that you can watch close by at the Prudential Center.

If you visit in the spring, experience the largest collection of cherry blossoms in the nation. Branch Brook Park blossoms with over 4,300 cherry trees, and h
host_about: You will find these Airbnbs to be bright, airy, and peaceful places for contemplation, studying, reading, working, and creating positive energy. Come to this urban zen studio to retreat from work/life, find creative inspiration, or feel ‘at home’ during your travels.

Located only 8 mins from Newark Int’l Airport, ~1 hr from NYC, and 13 mins from Downtown Newark, it’s truly a hidden gem.

Also includes bonus amenities — content creation gear, event space, guided meditations, smart lights, & more!

See ya soon. Namaste. 🙏🏾🖤

The space
The Space is bright and spacious. Has a very unique vibe — low-to-the-ground, minimalist, zen, creative, urban boho. You won’t find another property around here like it. The furnishing is intentionally modest, the energy is surprisingly palpable.

When you enter and you can’t help but take a deep sigh of relief. You’re at home. A safe space designed to inspire you to let go and allow your inner child to come out & pl
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the “peaceful with a flair” Clinton Hill neighborhood, at the heart of the renaissance occurring in Brick City.

Here you’ll find the best of Newark:
✔️ new creative initiatives (eg. Nina Simone Artist Housing Project, street art & murals)
✔️ community engagement in local politics
✔️ community farms, community centers, and other educational initiatives
✔️ new small/local businesses
✔️ new real estate & urban development projects
✔️ residential & commercial real estate investment opportunities
✔️a diverse community (ethnicities, nationalities, religions, wealth, professions, interests, etc)

And it’s only a ‘hop, skip, and jump’ away from local attractions in Newark’s Downtown District. Catch a Devils hockey game or a music concert at the Prudential Center, attend a classical performance at the NJ Performing Arts Center (NJPAC), grab a drink at a bar or wander into a small business on the iconic Halsey Street, visit the
host_about:
Helping anxious, overthinking high-achievers feel clarity, peace, & joy by mastering their energy.

I’m a Harvard grad & ex-Investment Banker turned Meditation Teacher & Transformational Coach.

Passionate about spirituality, wellbeing, self-expression, society & culture, business, community empowerment, and redefining the norm.

My core values are currently love, presence, pleasure, play, and learning.

Each moment, I strive to live in alignment with my values because I believe that the energy we put out into the Universe we attract back into our experience. In this way, we create our reality.

Looking forward to sharing space and good vibes with you soon!

neighborhood_overview:
This property sits just south of Downtown Newark. This area is very walkable and accessible to public transportation, making it easy to get around the city, within walking distance, a 13 minute walk from Prudential Center, 20-minute walk of New Jersey Performing Arts Center and 600 feet of Lincoln Park, where locals gather for events such as the popular Lincoln Park Music Festival, a community celebration of music, food, and culture that features live gospel, hip hop, and jazz. The New Jersey Institute of Technology, Newark Museum of Art, and Rutgers University Newark Campus sit nearby, so there are plenty of options for further education and entertainment around South Broad Street.

Popular points of interest near this accommodation is 10 min to Newark City Hall, Alumni Field and New Jersey Institute of Technology. The nearest airport is Newark Liberty International Airport, 2.5 miles and a 13-minute walk from Prudential Center.

name: Cozy Studio apartment in Newark
description:
This stylish place is perfect for a group trip. Fits 4 ppl with a full-size bed and air mattress. ~10min walk to the NJ Train - 20 mins to Manhattan on the NJ Transit train.

A great view located at an affordable price! With a feeling of being at home, away.

In building laundry. Quick snacks, nail spa, a peaceful park, a roller skating rink, and more are all located feet from the quarters.

The space
This spacious studio apartment has large panoramic windows where you can see the sunrise & reflections of the sunset. Beautiful views of NYC right in front of you.

A great amount of closet space for a long or short stay. You’ll be comfy either way.

Elevator access to designated floors with emergency exits located at the end of each hallway.

Guest access
The residential, laundry room & lawn area are in full access. There is a park not far from the living quarters if you want to have an outdoor gather
neighborhood_overview:
Lively yet peaceful diverse area. Summer activities such as basketball games, playgrounds, a pool, or a decent walk in the park are feet away from the residence. Or enjoy a quick spin on the electric scooters surrounding the area.

If you’re a cooker, there is a supermarket located within a decent walk of 25 mins or 8 min drive.

Restaurants and museums in the heart of the city in the Broad Street, University City area, and Ironbound to name a few.
host_about:
Hii! Hope you’re doing great :) 

I am a young professional in the tri-state area inviting lovely individuals to house sit and help me to study art abroad this fall. I enjoy my passion as an artist, making sustainable fashion. Traveling & meeting new people of different cultures is so fascinating. Maybe that’s a part of the reason I consider myself a hybrid.

You’re going to love it here! This studio is filled with great lighting and nice energy. I thrive off of a good wave of energy & calmness, which is why this is a great middle ground. I’ve made it so that you feel at home just as much as I do. Most of my time is spent here crafting & creating. So, it’s definitely an awesome stay for someone who is in tune with soothing vibrations. 

Looking forward to your enjoyable stay!

Thank you,

DJae
